message:
The above Variations go out of their way to make value judgements -- The definitions of Hope and Dream both begin with, "A desired future ..." 

Worry is about a projection of negative experience.  Confidence is a "Positive evaluation of how things will turn out."

Can the typical "vocab manipulations" be performed on these terms?

Can Hope be "an undesired future that will come about if things continue as expected"?
Yes, totally. An undesired future is still Hope, you're hoping it doesn't happen!

I guess Negative Hope could be "I have no hope...", which is not quite the same thing as "an undesired future..."

Thoughts?

How is worrysome the opposite of worry? 

Did you mean worryfun?
@MikeDerk I wasn't going for opposite so much as using your example of Hope and contrasting it with the normal Worry. The opposite of Worry, but still in the Worry camp, might be Unworried.

@MikeDerk I wasn't going for opposite so much as using your example of Hope and contrasting it with the normal Worry.  

The opposite of Worry, but still in the Worry camp, might be Unworried.
